articles.author: Adiel Kaplan and Courtney Kube
articles.title: Pentagon official says footage showed child present minutes before U.S. drone attack in Kabul
articles.description: A Pentagon review of the U.S. drone strike that killed 10 Afghan civilians on Aug. 29 found that video footage showed at least one child present before launch.
articles.content: A Pentagon review of the U.S. drone strike that killed 10 civilians, including seven children, in Kabul on Aug. 29 found that video footage showed at least one child present two minutes before the st… [+4082 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: At least 68 inmates dead in battle between Ecuador prison gangs
articles.description: A prolonged gunbattle between rival gangs inside Ecuador’s largest prison killed at least 68 inmates and wounded 25 on Saturday.

articles.author: Gabe Joselow and Rachel Elbaum
articles.title: The Taliban destroyed these ancient Buddhas. Now they're welcoming tourists to the site.
articles.description: The Taliban destroyed Afghanistan's Bamiyan Buddhas in early 2001. Now they're guarding the site and welcoming tourists.
articles.content:
BAMIYAN, Afghanistan The Talibans destruction of the Bamiyan Buddha statues in early 2001 shocked the world and highlighted their hard-line regime, toppled soon after in a U.S.-led invasion.

articles.title: U.S. weighs grim options if nuclear talks with Iran collapse
articles.description: Iran and world powers are due to resume talks next week, but prospects are bleak and the U.S. and its allies are weighing a grim set of choices if talks fail.

articles.title: 'Fast and loose': 'Rust' crew member quit over lack of safety day before fatal accident
articles.description: A member of the "Rust" crew resigned just days before the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, telling production she had a number of concerns including a lack of safety meetings.

articles.title: Iraq's prime minister survives assassination attempt, officials say
articles.description: Iraq's Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi is unharmed after an assassination attempt with an armed drone that targeted his residence Sunday, officials said.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD Iraqs Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi survived an assassination attempt with an armed drone that targeted his residence early Sunday, and is unharmed, officials said.
